alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Lanier; Lowndes (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 27 at 8:03PM EDT until April 27 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN LANIER...LOWNDES AND SOUTHEASTERN BROOKS COUNTIES... At 802 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles southwest of I-75 At Exit 16, or 9 miles east of Quitman, moving east at 35 mph. A wind gust of 58 mph has been measured about 4 miles south- southwest of Kinderlou in Lowndes county. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lake Park, Valdosta, Quitman, I-75 At Exit 16, Moody Air Force Base, Remerton, Dasher, Morven, Naylor, Greenwood, Twin Lakes, Valdosta Regional Airport, Kinderlou, I-75 At Exit 5, Nankin, Empress, Clyattville, Brooks Co A/p, Blue Springs and I-75 At Exit 22. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee.
